lead_paragraph: Banks are reducing risky assets to show regulators how strong they are. But sometimes the assets don’t actually move – the bank just shifts the risk, DealBook’s Susanne Craig reports. “As regulators press for banks to be safer, demand for these maneuvers — known as capital relief trades or regulatory capital trades — has been growing, especially in Europe.”

headline.main: Now You See the Risk, Now You Don’t
